Is that Meta, Clearview, the Calvert UK road font, or what?

hhp
author: hrant

comments.content:
I think you're probably right about it being [Transport Heavy](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621110553/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=UR.110027.0.2&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=Rafah&sampleSize=48), [Jock Kinneir](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621110553/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Jock%20Kinneir) and [Margaret Calvert](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621110553/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Margaret%20Calvert)'s 1963 design for UK road signs.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621110553im_/http:/typophile.com/files/rafah.jpg)
  
I've always had the impression that Kinneir did most of the font and Calvert did most of the symbols.

Richard

Cool, thanks. That's pretty sophisticated for Gaza...  
And I didn't realize the font was available for pubic use.

hhp

pubic, schmubic… let's call the whole thing off…

but seriously(?!), I didn't think about it this morning, they're using the wrong weight.

Transport comes in two weights, heavy for use on a light ground and medium on dark grounds.

For those who are interested, further particulars can be found [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621110553/http:/www.dft.gov.uk/stellent/groups/dft_control/documents/contentservertemplate/dft_index.hcst?n=9430&l=3)

Richard
